verses.text: From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?

similars.text: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

Behold, we have not come out to battle against you that we might shed your blood for power; neither do we desire to bring any one to the yoke of bondage. But this is the very cause for which ye have come against us; yea, and ye are angry with us because of our religion.

verses.text: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.

similars.text: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.

Yea, and this is not all; I command you by all the desires which ye have for life, that ye deliver up your weapons of war unto us, and we will seek not your blood, but we will spare your lives, if ye will go your way and come not again to war against us.
From whence come wars and fightings among you? come they not hence, even of your lusts that war in your members?

verses.text: Ye ask, and receive not, because ye ask amiss, that ye may consume it upon your lusts.

similars.text: Ye lust, and have not: ye kill, and desire to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and war, yet ye have not, because ye ask not.
Behold this is my will; ask and ye shall receive; but men do not always do my will.
For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.
Grant not, O Lord, the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.

verses.text: Ye adulterers and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of the world is enmity with God? whosoever therefore will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.
Do ye think that the scripture saith in vain, The spirit that dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?
But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.

similars.text: Yea, he that truly humbleth himself, and repenteth of his sins, and endureth to the end, the same shall be blessed--yea, much more blessed than they who are compelled to be humble because of their exceeding poverty.
Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder. Yea, all of you be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

verses.text: Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

similars.text: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.
Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.
For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more shall not we escape, if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven:
Wherefore will ye plead with me? ye all have transgressed against me, saith the Lord.

And now behold, we are prepared to receive you; yea, and except you withdraw your purposes, behold, ye will pull down the wrath of that God whom you have rejected upon you, even to your utter destruction.
Yea, cry unto him against the devil, who is an enemy to all righteousness.
Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.
The Lord shall cause thine enemies that rise up against thee to be smitten before thy face: they shall come out against thee one way, and flee before thee seven ways.

verses.text: Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you. Cleanse your hands, ye sinners; and purify your hearts, ye double minded.

similars.text: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.
Abide ye in the liberty wherewith ye are made free; entangle not yourselves in sin, but let your hands be clean, until the Lord comes.
Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.

verses.text: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to heaviness.

similars.text: Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.
A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;
Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
Woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. Woe unto you that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.

verses.text: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.

similars.text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:
Lift up your hands in the sanctuary, and bless the Lord.
Now will I rise, saith the Lord; now will I be exalted; now will I lift up myself.
The Lord lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
Lift up your hearts and be glad, for I am in your midst, and am your advocate with the Father; and it is his good will to give you the kingdom.
Knowing that he which raised up the Lord Jesus shall raise up us also by Jesus, and shall present us with you.
Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.
Behold, I am Jesus Christ, the Son of God, and I will lift them up at the last day. Even so. Amen.
The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.
Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.
Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.
And now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.

O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high mountain; O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God!
There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? Lord, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.
Unto thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
Therefore thus saith the Lord God; I have lifted up mine hand, Surely the heathen that are about you, they shall bear their shame.
And I will strengthen them in the Lord; and they shall walk up and down in his name, saith the Lord.
Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time:
Be thou humble; and the Lord thy God shall lead thee by the hand, and give thee answer to thy prayers.

verses.text: Speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of his brother, and judgeth his brother, speaketh evil of the law, and judgeth the law: but if thou judge the law, thou art not a doer of the law, but a judge.

similars.text: Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.

If one man sin against another, the judge shall judge him: but if a man sin against the Lord, who shall entreat for him? Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto the voice of their father, because the Lord would slay them.
Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother's eye.

And now, my son, I have somewhat more to say unto thee than what I said unto thy brother; for behold, have ye not observed the steadiness of thy brother, his faithfulness, and his diligence in keeping the commandments of God? Behold, has he not set a good example for thee?
But he that hateth his brother is in darkness, and walketh in darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, because that darkness hath blinded his eyes.
Judge not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven:
Thou shalt not speak evil of thy neighbor, nor do him any harm.

And the brother of Jared repented of the evil which he had done, and did call upon the name of the Lord for his brethren who were with him. And the Lord said unto him: I will forgive thee and thy brethren of their sins; but thou shalt not sin any more, for ye shall remember that my Spirit will not always strive with man; wherefore, if ye will sin until ye are fully ripe ye shall be cut off from the presence of the Lord. And these are my thoughts upon the land which I shall give you for your inheritance; for it shall be a land choice above all other lands.
Moreover if thy brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell him his fault between thee and him alone: if he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother.
Know ye not, brethren, (for I speak to them that know the law,) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth?
Thou therefore which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?
Wherefore, take heed, my beloved brethren, that ye do not judge that which is evil to be of God, or that which is good and of God to be of the devil.
And if thy brother that dwelleth by thee be waxen poor, and be sold unto thee; thou shalt not compel him to serve as a bondservant:
Then shall ye do unto him, as he had thought to have done unto his brother: so shalt thou put the evil away from among you.

If any man see his brother sin a sin which is not unto death, he shall ask, and he shall give him life for them that sin not unto death. There is a sin unto death: I do not say that he shall pray for it.
Then said Paul, I wist not, brethren, that he was the high priest: for it is written, Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people.

verses.text: There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?

similars.text: For the Lord is our judge, the Lord is our lawgiver, the Lord is our king; he will save us.

verses.text: Go to now, ye that say, To day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain:
Whereas ye know not what shall be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth for a little time, and then vanisheth away.
For that ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this, or that.

similars.text: Verily I say, for this cause ye shall do these things.
And it shall be, if thou go with us, yea, it shall be, that what goodness the Lord shall do unto us, the same will we do unto thee.
And this shall be a sign unto thee from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken;

And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the Lord; Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.
That the Lord thy God may shew us the way wherein we may walk, and the thing that we may do.
For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord's.
If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
For he said unto them: What ye shall do unto me shall be a type of things to come.
Go thou near, and hear all that the Lord our God shall say: and speak thou unto us all that the Lord our God shall speak unto thee; and we will hear it, and do it.
Saying, What wilt thou that I shall do unto thee? And he said, Lord, that I may receive my sight.
And he that doeth according to these things shall be saved, and he that doeth them not shall be damned if he so continue.
For now we live, if ye stand fast in the Lord.
And Moses said, This is the thing which the Lord commanded that ye should do: and the glory of the Lord shall appear unto you.

For I am the Lord: I will speak, and the word that I shall speak shall come to pass; it shall be no more prolonged: for in your days, O rebellious house, will I say the word, and will perform it, saith the Lord God.
Keep therefore the words of this covenant, and do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye do.
And the Lord said unto him: Believest thou the words which I shall speak?
And this will we do, if God permit.
Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
And I said, What shall I do, Lord? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.
Arise; for this matter belongeth unto thee: we also will be with thee: be of good courage, and do it.
I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the Lord.
If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.
And I give unto you a commandment that ye shall do these things. And if ye shall always do these things blessed are ye, for ye are built upon my rock.
For thus saith the Lord unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:
And Micaiah said, As the Lord liveth, what the Lord saith unto me, that will I speak.
And thus ye shall do in all cases which shall come before you.
And now, O our God, what shall we say after this? for we have forsaken thy commandments,

When I shall say to the righteous, that he shall surely live; if he trust to his own righteousness, and commit iniquity, all his righteousnesses shall not be remembered; but for his iniquity that he hath committed, he shall die for it.
What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?

I the Lord have spoken it: it shall come to pass, and I will do it; I will not go back, neither will I spare, neither will I repent; according to thy ways, and according to thy doings, shall they judge thee, saith the Lord God.
Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?
And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?
Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of the Lord our God, to whom we send thee; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of the Lord our God.
And thou shalt do according to the sentence, which they of that place which the Lord shall choose shall shew thee; and thou shalt observe to do according to all that they inform thee:
And thou shalt swear, The Lord liveth, in truth, in judgment, and in righteousness; and the nations shall bless themselves in him, and in him shall they glory.

And whatsoever they shall speak when moved upon by the Holy Ghost shall be scripture, shall be the will of the Lord, shall be the mind of the Lord, shall be the word of the Lord, shall be the voice of the Lord, and the power of God unto salvation.

And Ittai answered the king, and said, As the Lord liveth, and as my lord the king liveth, surely in what place my lord the king shall be, whether in death or life, even there also will thy servant be.
Ye shall walk in all the ways which the Lord your God hath commanded you, that ye may live, and that it may be well with you, and that ye may prolong your days in the land which ye shall possess.

And whosoever doeth this, and keepeth the commandments of God from thenceforth, the same will remember that I say unto him, yea, he will remember that I have said unto him, he shall have eternal life, according to the testimony of the Holy Spirit, which testifieth in me.
It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:
And the servant said unto his lord: When shall these things be?

And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken diligently unto the voice of the Lord thy God, to observe and to do all his commandments which I command thee this day, that the Lord thy God will set thee on high above all nations of the earth:

Observe and hear all these words which I command thee, that it may go well with thee, and with thy children after thee for ever, when thou doest that which is good and right in the sight of the Lord thy God.
Therefore shall ye keep my commandments, and do them: I am the Lord.

verses.text: But now ye rejoice in your boastings: all such rejoicing is evil.

similars.text: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
But rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partakers of Christ's sufferings; that, when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding joy.

verses.text: Therefore to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to him it is sin.

similars.text: For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.
For behold, God hath said a man being evil cannot do that which is good; for if he offereth a gift, or prayeth unto God, except he shall do it with real intent it profiteth him nothing.
Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
Good and upright is the Lord: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.
If he has desired to do evil, and has not repented in his days, behold, evil shall be done unto him, according to the restoration of God.
But go ye and learn what that meaneth, I will have mercy, and not sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
Thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.

But whatsoever thing persuadeth men to do evil, and believe not in Christ, and deny him, and serve not God, then ye may know with a perfect knowledge it is of the devil; for after this manner doth the devil work, for he persuadeth no man to do good, no, not one; neither do his angels; neither do they who subject themselves unto him.
With good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men:
Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.
Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.
But to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly, his faith is counted for righteousness.
For he hath made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.
He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the Lord, happy is he.

He hath given unto you that ye might know good from evil, and he hath given unto you that ye might choose life or death; and ye can do good and be restored unto that which is good, or have that which is good restored unto you; or ye can do evil, and have that which is evil restored unto you.
Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin.
None of his sins that he hath committed shall be mentioned unto him: he hath done that which is lawful and right; he shall surely live.
And if a soul sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the Lord; though he wist it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.
